alert.note: Alert for Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 4:44PM EST until February 17 at 11:34PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Clinch River Near Richlands affecting Tazewell County. .Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches in less than 24 hours caused the Clinch River to flood at Richlands. The river has crested and will fall below flood stage this evening. For the Clinch River...including Richlands...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clinch River Near Richlands. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:22 PM EST Friday the stage was 10.8 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:22 PM EST Friday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 03/07/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
